job_description: AGM-HR, Admin & Security : Ashulia Women and Children Hospital Jobs ENG ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶Ç‡¶≤‡¶æ Create Account Sign In For Employer Create Sign In Home Jobs Mybdjobs Job List Ashulia Women and Children Hospital AGM-HR, Admin & Security Application Deadline : 18 Mar 2026 Apply Now Shortlist Share: Facebook LinkedIn WhatsApp All Requirements Responsibilities Salary & Benefits Company Information Summary Vacancy: 1 Age: 35 to 50 years Location: Dhaka (Ashulia) Salary: Negotiable Experience: At least 10 years Published: 16 Feb 2026 To access Application Insights Get Bdjobs Pro Requirements Education Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA) Master of Business Administration (MBA) Experience At least 10 years The applicants should have experience in the following business area(s): Hospital Additional Requirements Age 35 to 50 years MBA in HRM /Masters in Public Administration and professional degree in labor law will get preference. The applicants having experience in hospital business area will get preference. Good communication skill both in English & Bangla. Computer literacy and knowledge in KPI method of PA. Responsibilities & Context Responsibilities of HR and Admin department Key responsibilities are to provide meaningful input for formulating and implementation of HR related policies. Initiate a change management strategy to bring effective changes in leadership abilities at all levels of executives. Implement HR strategy that ensures continued matching of resource capability with existing and future business development and growth objectives of AWCH. Implement KRA for all permanent employees. Implement Performance Management Systems (PMS) to ensure that the business has a framework for measuring and improving the performance of people and monitoring progress. Responsible for the selection, supervision, and evaluation of interdisciplinary team members. Ensure that accurate job descriptions are in place for all staff of AWCH. Provide assistance when conducting staff performance evaluations. Identify training and organizational development opportunities with the help of senior management and departmental heads. Lead staff training sessions, workshops and activities. To assist in developing human resource plans for the senior management. Initiate punitive measures, including counselling for the deteriorated performance of any employee of AWCH. Participate in interviews with the recruitment committee at all levels. Conduct exit/entry interviews for employees at any level. Promote workplace safety. To maintain good communication and pay proper respect to the clinicians. To respond humbly and appropriately to any queries from clinicians regarding HR matters. Ensure proper vehicle management of AWCH-rented and own cars/microbuses for effective use. Periodic survey of compensation and benefits to remain competitive within the industry. To execute of organizations administrative plan, policies and decisions of the Management. As Himalaya`s reach spread in various segments, we underwent a rebranding to bring our entire range of offerings under the single umbrella "Himalaya Since 1930". We consolidated our portfolios in Pharmaceuticals, Personal Care, BabyCare, Himalaya for Moms, Wellness, and Animal Health. Today, Himalaya is a leading global herbal health and personal care organization with close to 500 products in over 100 countries. Nurse - Cannula Specialist Application Deadline : 18 Mar 2026 Apply Now Shortlist Share: Facebook LinkedIn WhatsApp All Requirements Responsibilities Company Information Summary Vacancy: -- Location: Madaripur Published: 16 Feb 2026 To access Application Insights Get Bdjobs Pro Requirements Education Additional Requirements Special training or certification in IV therapy and cannulation, often documented through competency assessments. Strong skills in aseptic technique, vein selection, patient assessment, and complication management. Good communication and documentation ‚Äî particularly when teaching others or explaining procedures to patients. Responsibilities & Context ‚ÄúNurse ‚Äî Cannula Specialist‚Äù refers to a registered nurse who has advanced skills and often extra responsibilities in IV (intravenous) access and cannulation procedures ‚Äî essentially someone who is highly competent at inserting and managing cannulas safely and effectively. What Does a Cannula Specialist Nurse Do? Expert in IV Cannulation A cannula specialist nurse is highly skilled in inserting peripheral IV cannulas into a patient‚Äôs vein ‚Äî ensuring proper technique, aseptic (infection-free) procedures, and patient comfort. They may handle difficult venous access (hard-to-find or fragile veins) that other nurses struggle with. Infusion & IV Therapy Expertise They administer IV fluids, medications, blood products, and nutrition via cannulas following protocols. They monitor patients closely during infusions, watch for adverse reactions, and respond appropriately. Monitoring and Aftercare After inserting a cannula, this nurse checks regularly for complications (e.g., swelling, infection, infiltration). They ensure cannulas stay patent (open and working) and coordinate flushing or changing lines as needed. Educator and Mentor Many cannula specialists train and support other nurses to develop cannulation skills and competency. They may help standardize best practices for IV therapy within the nursing team. Clinical Resource & Leadership They act as a resource for clinical decision-making related to vascular access (including when to escalate to other specialists). In some hospital systems, they participate in audit, quality improvement, and policy development around cannulation care. Skills & Expertise Suggested by cannula Nurse/ Paramedics Nurse Workplace Work at office Employment Status Full Time Job Location Madaripur Company Information Planet Hospital. COMPETENCIES: Facilitating group meetings, managing timelines, oral and written fluency in both Bangla and English, handling critical issues with relevant stakeholders Responsibilities & Context BRAC is an international development organisation founded in Bangladesh in 1972 that partners globally with over 100 million people living with inequality and poverty to create opportunities to realise their potential. This position carries the responsibility of planning, managing, implementing, and monitoring activities at the camp distribution point for various aspects of the shelter project. This includes overseeing stock updates, token distribution, and daily in/out updates to the stock register. Additionally, the role involves managing the camp distribution point, maintaining the filing system, and updating asset data in the database. The incumbent is expected to dedicate 100% of their time to the camp office within their assigned working areas. They will report directly to the Deputy Project Manager of Supply Chain and collaborate with the respective camp focal to fulfil their duties effectively. Receive and issue store materials with proper records in professional manner as well as maintain management wise inventory and delivery sheet separately in Distribution point at camps. Ensure proper maintain and operation of the store, like as the activities of safe receive, storage, retrieval and timely dispatch and maintain register as per the waybill and GRN. Maintain manual register and online inventory software for data recording. Prepare periodic stock report (weekly/monthly/yearly) of distribution point, notification of inventory expiry or damage well before. Maintain accuracy in manual register and inventory software with reference to the receive/dispatch challan. Ensure dumper transport requisition a day before the material delivery at camp distribution point. Maintain FIFO (First in First out) & LEFO (Last Expired First Out) methods as per materials wise. Prepare all inventory items in a countable manner throughout the year. Arr
